caption:
This photograph captures a tranquil, rural scene. In the foreground, a white, wooden fence stretches from the left to the right side of the image, guiding the viewer's eye into the distance. The fence sits on lush green grass and is adorned intermittently with pink flowers.

Behind the fence on the left side, a large tree with a divided trunk features prominently, its branches laden with dense green foliage. In the middle distance, there's a yellow house with a sloped roof and a visible dark door. It's partially obscured by the foliage of the tree and another coniferous tree beside it.

The background is mostly obscured by the multiple trees planted around the fenced yard. The overall atmosphere suggests a peaceful, well-tended domestic rural environment, possibly a farm or a country home. The image is rich in natural colors like green and earthy tones, contrasting with the bright white of the fence and the soft yellow of the house.
title: Roy Fly Ranch near Sarpy Basin. Close to the surface of the 25,000 square mile area, known as the Powder River Basin, lies the largest deposit of low-sulphur coal in America. Many ranchers, who own land in the area, are refusing to sell their land to the coal companies.
